document.title: Deployment Prerequisites
document.paragraph:
Before deploying projects created using EiffelEnvision, you should ensure that your project is in a state to be deployed. Failure to do so will result in incomplete ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconDeployingSolution.htmdeployment projects.
deplyoment_requirements2Deployment Requirements Before an EiffelEnvision project can be deployed successfully using the integrated ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmSetup and Deployment projects installed with Visual Studio .NET, the following list of conditions are required to be met.
A project exists in the same ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxconSolutions.htmsolution as the ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmSetup and Deployment project.
The EiffelEnvision project can be successfully compiled. Note: EiffelEnvision projects do not need to be built/compiled prior to deployment; however, examining an added ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconFeaturesFilesFoldersDeployment.htmproject output will not show all of the files generated at build time. Once built, an EiffelEnvision project output will show all of the files that will be deployed. deplyoment_recommendations2Recommendations Although not necessary, it is recommended that before adding an EiffelEnvision project output to a deployment project, you build your EiffelEnvision project(s). Projects that have been built prior to adding their output to the deployment project will ensure all dependencies are evaluated and added to the deployment project automatically. It also serves to self- validate what will be included in the deployment project when built, by examining the project ms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxurfOutputsDialogBox.htmoutput. EiffelEnvision projects are different from C#, VB.NET and other such projects. EiffelEnvision's compiler is incremental and produces many additional assembly modules when not ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmloptimize_codeOptimizing Code, which can only be evaluated and included into the deployment project once built. If you choose not to build the EiffelEnvision project before adding its output to the deployment project, all newly generated files will be added automatically to the deployment project when built.
When deploying projects for distribution, it is recommended to configure your project to ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/build.xmloptimize_codeoptimizing the compilation as this will create a single deployment module resulting in faster load and execution times. It is also recommended to disable generation of a project's ../eiffelenvision_projects/configuring/project_configuration/debugging.xmlgenerate_debug_informationdebug information. This will dramatically reduce file size because the debug information will not be included in the deployment project automatically. also_see2Related SectionsSee Also:index.xmlDeploying Projectsms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vbconwhichtypeofdeploymentproject.htmSetup and Deployment Projectsms-help//MS.VSCC.2003/MS.MSDNQTR.2003FEB.1033/vsintro7/html/vxtskcreatingandeditingconfigurations.htmConfiguration Manager
